required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Positive Airway Pressure in Preeclampsia to Reduce Blood Pressure
clinical_study.official_title: Use of PAP in Women With Pre-eclampsia

collaborator.agency: National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to identify whether sleep-disordered breathing - as measured by overnight polysomnography - is associated with pre-eclampsia and to determine whether use of positive airway pressure can improve nocturnal blood pressure.

detailed_description.textblock: Initial enrollment began with only women with a pre-existing diagnosis of pre-eclampsia. Part way through the study, IRB granted approval to expand recruitment to include other hypertensive diagnoses. So, in effect, a more accurate post hoc title would be Study of Positive Airway Pressure to Reduce Blood Pressure in Hypertensive Pregnancies.

primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline and 1 week after PAP treatment.
primary_outcome.description: measured by a 24 hour cuff, averaged across the night;

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Worsening of Hypertension
primary_outcome.description: This outcome measure's purpose was to look at the impact of the APAP on blood pressure. This was done categorically by looking at worsening of hypertension with or without escalation of antihypertensive medications.

Severity of sleep disordered breathing, using the apnea/hypopnea index (number of respiratory evens per hour of sleep), among participants who have or do not have nocturnal hypertension. Obstructive sleep apnea is typically considered present if the AHI is at least 5.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Sleep-disordered Breathing (SDB)
primary_outcome.description: Presence or absence of SDB (defined as an apnea/hypopnea index; AHI>=5)

secondary_outcome.description: Number of mothers who had one (or more) babies admitted to NICU

arm_group.description: This arm was women who used auto-titrating positive airway pressure (APAP) for at least 4 hours per night

No one was assigned to this arm, but for results data quality purposes, women assigned to PAP who were explicitly non-compliant (used less than 4 hours per night), were analyzed separately from women who were compliant with the PAP assignment.

intervention.description: Women will use positive airway pressure until delivery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women with preeclampsia who receive care at the University of Michigan Hospitals
- No current use of PAP therapy.
- Willing and able to provide informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Current PAP therapy
- Any medical reason why PAP therapy may not be suitable (e.g., in patients with recent head trauma).
- Cognitively impaired and unable to understand informed consent.

results_reference.citation: O'Brien LM, Bullough AS, Chames MC, Shelgikar AV, Armitage R, Guilleminualt C, Sullivan CE, Johnson TR, Chervin RD. Hypertension, snoring, and obstructive sleep apnoea during pregnancy: a cohort study. BJOG. 2014 Dec;121(13):1685-93. doi: 10.1111/1471-0528.12885. Epub 2014 May 30.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Pregnant women with hypertension were recruited from University of Michigan obstetric clinics and inpatient areas. Enrollment into the trial occurred between March 2010 and November 2013.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: After signing consent, one participant decided not to have any sleep studies performed, explaining the difference between the 125 enrolled listed in the registration section and the 124 followed below.

group.title: Compliant Users APAP
group.description: Women who used APAP at least 4 hours per night. Auto-titrating Positive Airway Pressure: Women will use APAP until delivery. Nocturnal blood pressure will be assessed at two time points: 1 week of APAP use and at regular intervals across pregnancy. Daytime blood pressure measurements across pregnancy will be obtained from medical records along with delivery information.

group.title: Non-Compliant APAP
group.description: Women who were in the APAP arm but who used less than 4 hours per night

group.title: Standard of Care
group.description: Women in the standard of care group will have clinical blood pressure measurements extracted from medical records. Delivery information will also be collected.

period.title: APAP Initiation to Week 1 or Delivery

participants_list.participants: 4 delivered before APAP initiation 7 elected not to have APAP following baseline study

baseline.population: These data are for those who initiated APAP only and do not include the standard of care arm as they did not have nocturnal blood pressure

group.title: Compliant Autotitrating Positive Airway Pressure (APAP)
group.description: Women who used APAP for at least 4 hours/night

group.title: Non-compliant APAP
group.description: Women who did not use APAP for at least 4 hours/night

group.title: Standard Care
group.description: Non-APAP arm

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measurement_list.measurement: Standard of care group did not have nocturnal blood pressure measures
Standard of care group did not have nocturnal blood pressure measures

measure.title: sleep study apnea hypopnea index (AHI)
measure.description: Number of respiratory events per hour of sleep

measurement_list.measurement: The standard of care arm did not undergo a sleep study

outcome.title: Nocturnal Blood Pressure
outcome.description: measured by a 24 hour cuff, averaged across the night;
outcome.time_frame: baseline and 1 week after PAP treatment.
outcome.population: The standard of care group did not have nocturnal blood pressure monitoring as they were not assigned to use a positive airway pressure device

group.title: Positive Airway Pressure Adherent
group.description: Positive Airway Pressure: Women will use positive airway pressure until delivery

group.title: Positive Airway Pressure Non Adherent
group.description: Positive Airway Pressure: Women who used positive airway pressure for limited time

measure.title: Nocturnal Blood Pressure
measure.description: measured by a 24 hour cuff, averaged across the night;
measure.population: The standard of care group did not have nocturnal blood pressure monitoring as they were not assigned to use a positive airway pressure device

analysis.groups_desc: unadjusted systolic blood pressure at baseline between groups
Unadjusted diastolic blood pressure at baseline between groups

Unadjusted diastolic blood pressure at week 1

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Worsening of Hypertension
outcome.description: This outcome measure's purpose was to look at the impact of the APAP on blood pressure. This was done categorically by looking at worsening of hypertension with or without escalation of antihypertensive medications.
outcome.population: One woman in the standard of care group died during pregnancy and is therefore not included in this analysis.

group.title: Positive Airway Pressure Adherent
group.description: Positive Airway Pressure: Women will use positive airway pressure until delivery

group.title: Positive Airway Pressure Non Adherent
group.description: Positive Airway Pressure: Women who used positive airway pressure for limited time

measure.title: Number of Participants With Worsening of Hypertension
measure.description: This outcome measure's purpose was to look at the impact of the APAP on blood pressure. This was done categorically by looking at worsening of hypertension with or without escalation of antihypertensive medications.
measure.population: One woman in the standard of care group died during pregnancy and is therefore not included in this analysis.

outcome.title: Severity of Sleep Disordered Breathing
outcome.description: Severity of sleep disordered breathing, using the apnea/hypopnea index (number of respiratory evens per hour of sleep), among participants who have or do not have nocturnal hypertension. Obstructive sleep apnea is typically considered present if the AHI is at least 5.
outcome.population: This reflects only the n=43 women who underwent baseline sleep study (n=7 of whom did not go on to receive APAP therapy) prior to assignment to PAP therapy. The standard of care group did not have a baseline sleep study and are therefore not represented here. Of these n=43 women, n=36 received PAP therapy (n=20 were adherent and n=16 were not).

group.title: Nocturnal Hypertension
group.description: Women with nocturnal hypertension (defined as blood pressure >117/68mmHg between 26-30 weeks and >123/72mmHg after 30 weeks)

group.title: No Nocturnal Hypertension
group.description: Women without nocturnal hypertension

measure.title: Severity of Sleep Disordered Breathing
measure.description: Severity of sleep disordered breathing, using the apnea/hypopnea index (number of respiratory evens per hour of sleep), among participants who have or do not have nocturnal hypertension. Obstructive sleep apnea is typically considered present if the AHI is at least 5.
measure.population: This reflects only the n=43 women who underwent baseline sleep study (n=7 of whom did not go on to receive APAP therapy) prior to assignment to PAP therapy. The standard of care group did not have a baseline sleep study and are therefore not represented here. Of these n=43 women, n=36 received PAP therapy (n=20 were adherent and n=16 were not).

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Sleep-disordered Breathing (SDB)
outcome.description: Presence or absence of SDB (defined as an apnea/hypopnea index; AHI>=5)
outcome.population: This reflects only the n=43 women who underwent baseline sleep study (n=7 of whom did not go on to receive APAP therapy) prior to assignment to PAP therapy. The standard of care group did not have a baseline sleep study and are therefore not represented here. Of these n=43 women, n=36 received PAP therapy (n=20 were adherent and n=16 were not).

group.description: Women with nocturnal hypertension (defined as blood pressure >117/68mmHg between 26-30 weeks and >123/72mmHg after 30 weeks)

group.description: Women without nocturnal hypertension

measure.description: Presence or absence of SDB (defined as an apnea/hypopnea index; AHI>=5)
measure.population: This reflects only the n=43 women who underwent baseline sleep study (n=7 of whom did not go on to receive APAP therapy) prior to assignment to PAP therapy. The standard of care group did not have a baseline sleep study and are therefore not represented here. Of these n=43 women, n=36 received PAP therapy (n=20 were adherent and n=16 were not).

reported_events.time_frame: from start of intervention until 30 days after intervention (generally 30 days after delivery)
reported_events.desc: NOTE: All cause mortality table reflects maternal death only - as babies were not participants. Inpatient hospitalizations were not collected as data for adverse event collection (and therefore are not included in Serious Adverse Events reporting) because this was a study of high risk pregnancies, so recruitment came from inpatient candidates as well as from the community. For non-serious adverse events: study did not collect ordinary aspects of pregnancy such as nausea.

group.title: Positive Airway Pressure
group.description: Positive Airway Pressure: Women will use positive airway pressure until delivery

event.description: pre-existing severe fetal growth restrictions involved in both cases; IRB approved determination that these are unrelated to study participation or intervention. Neonatal deaths not tracked in standard of care arm
severe growth restriction of fetus with no interval growth on serial ultrasounds as well as oligohydramnios

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: These tables represent full basic analysis of all the participants enrolled without adjustment for confounding variables. Future publications will present more complex subsequent analyses.
